rules.ruleString: Must have passed an (I/W) unit in {OCC1011}
Must be enrolled in course version {3869, M3001}

description: The unit introduces student to the historical origins of the use of occupation as theory and the theory of core elements of occupational therapy intervention. Current theoretical concepts and models underpinning occupational therapy practice will be explored along with the occupational therapy problem solving and clinical reasoning process. Case scenarios will be used throughout and students will learn the problem solving strategies that will support their learning in occupational therapy intervention units elsewhere in the course.
faculty: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences
